DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to compare the effects of ciprofibrate versus omega-3 fatty acid supplementation on the vascular structure and function in hypertensive patients with hypertriglyceridemia.
DOC.brief_title: Fish Oil Supplementation and Vascular Function in Hypertensive Patients With Hypertriglyceridemia
DOC.detailed_description: Hypertensive patients aged 40-65 years, both genders, presenting serum triglycerides levels higher than 150 mg/dl will be randomized into two groups. The first group will be receiving ciprofibrate 100mg/day and the second group will be receiving fish oil 1800mg/day. All patients will be evaluated with brachial flow-mediated dilation and with EndoPAT to assess endothelial function before and after supplementation. SPHYGMOCOR and pulse wave velocity (PWV) measurements will also be obtained.
DOC.criteria: Previous diagnosis of hypertension Patients with serum triglycerides levels ≥ 150 mg/dl and <500 mg/dl Patients on stable antihypertensive medication for at least 4 weeks Patients with food consumption maintained for at least 4 weeks Smoking Secondary hypertension Hormone replacement therapy Diabetes mellitus Chronic kidney disease Known coronary artery disease Previous stroke Dyslipidemia severe, with LDL cholesterol> 160 mg/dL or triglycerides ≥ 500 mg/dl Use of statins or beta blockers
